content.description: The following question refers to the topic of global markets in the 1600s and 1700s.
content.question: Which of the following best explains why, in the 1600s and 1700s, Britain and the Netherlands were able overcome Portuguese dominance of the trading networks of India and the East Indies?

choices.label: They had greater domestic productivity and access to more abundant resources.
They placed greater stress on religious conversion of local inhabitants.
They concentrated on Asian colonization and trade, whereas Portugal had extensive American colonial territories.
They largely limited their territorial holdings in Asia to coastal trading posts.

content.answer: They had greater domestic productivity and access to more abundant resources.

unit.text: 5: Conflict, Crisis, and Reaction in the Late 18th Century

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain a historical concept, development, or process.
